RateLimit-Limit.description: The maximum requests available in the current duration.

RateLimit-Remaining.description: How many requests are left in the current duration.

RateLimit-Reset.description: Timestamp in the future the duration will reset.

Retry-After.description: Seconds in the future to retry the request, if rate limited.

NotFound.description: The specified resource was not found.

Unauthenticated.description: The API key is missing or otherwise invalid.

Unauthorized.description: The current API key is not authorized to perform this action.

Validation.description: The request failed one or more validations.

documentId.description: Identifier for the associated document, if any.

archivedAt.description: The date and time that this object was archived

color.description: A color representing the collection, this is used to help make collections more identifiable in the UI. It should be in HEX format including the #

createdAt.description: The date and time that this object was created

deletedAt.description: The date and time that this object was deleted

description.description: A description of the collection, may contain markdown formatting

icon.description: A string that represents an icon in the outline-icons package or an emoji

index.description: The position of the collection in the sidebar

sharing.description: Whether public document sharing is enabled in this collection

sort.description: The sort of documents in the collection. Note that not all API responses respect this and it is left as a frontend concern to implement.

updatedAt.description: The date and time that this object was last changed

urlId.description: A short unique identifier that can be used to identify the collection instead of the UUID.

anchorText.description: The document text that the comment is anchored to, only included if includeAnchorText=true.

createdAt.description: The date and time that this object was created

data.description: The editor data representing this comment.

documentId.description: Identifier for the document this is related to.

parentCommentId.description: Identifier for the comment this is a child of, if any.

updatedAt.description: The date and time that this object was last changed

archivedAt.description: The date and time that this object was archived

createdAt.description: The date and time that this object was created

deletedAt.description: The date and time that this object was deleted

emoji.description: An emoji associated with the document.

fullWidth.description: Whether this document should be displayed in a full-width view.

parentDocumentId.description: Identifier for the document this is a child of, if any.

pinned.description: Whether this document is pinned in the collection

publishedAt.description: The date and time that this object was published

revision.description: A number that is auto incrementing with every revision of the document that is saved

template.description: Whether this document is a template

templateId.description: Unique identifier for the template this document was created from, if any

text.description: The text content of the document, contains markdown formatting

updatedAt.description: The date and time that this object was last changed

urlId.description: A short unique ID that can be used to identify the document as an alternative to the UUID

actorId.description: The user that performed the action.

actorIpAddress.description: The ip address the action was performed from. This field is only returned when the `auditLog` boolean is true.

collectionId.description: Identifier for the associated collection, if any

createdAt.description: The date and time that this event was created

data.description: Additional unstructured data associated with the event

documentId.description: Identifier for the associated document, if any

modelId.description: Identifier for the object this event is associated with when it is not one of document, collection, or user.

createdAt.description: The date and time that this object was created

size.description: The size of the resulting file in bytes

state.description: The state of the file operation.

createdAt.description: The date and time that this object was created

memberCount.description: The number of users that are members of the group

updatedAt.description: The date and time that this object was last changed

name.description: The full name of the user being invited

avatarUrl.description: A URL pointing to an image representing the OAuth client.

clientId.description: The client ID for the OAuth client.

clientSecret.description: The client secret for the OAuth client.

createdAt.description: Date and time when this OAuth client was created

description.description: A short description of this OAuth client.
description.example: Integrate Acme Inc's services into Outline.

developerName.description: The name of the developer who created this OAuth client.

developerUrl.description: The URL of the developer who created this OAuth client.

name.description: The name of this OAuth client.

published.description: Whether the OAuth client is available to other workspaces.

redirectUris.description: The redirect URIs for the OAuth client.

updatedAt.description: Date and time when this OAuth client was updated

abilities.description: A mapping of ability names to boolean values indicating whether the current user can perform the action.

id.description: Unique identifier for the object this policy references.

createdAt.description: Date and time when this revision was created

text.description: Body of the document, may contain markdown formatting

answer.description: An answer to the query, if possible
answer.example: Our hiring policy can be summarized asâ€¦

createdAt.description: The date and time that this object was created
Date and time when this share was created

includeChildDocuments.description: If to also give permission to view documents nested beneath this one.

lastAccessedAt.description: Date and time when this share was last viewed

published.description: If true the share can be loaded without a user account.

updatedAt.description: Date and time when this share was edited

url.description: URL of the publicly shared document.

collectionId.description: Unique identifier for the starred collection.

createdAt.description: Date and time when this star was created

documentId.description: Unique identifier for the starred document.

index.description: Index of the star in the list of stars.

items.description: A hostname that user emails are restricted to

avatarUrl.description: The URL for the image associated with this team, it will be displayed in the team switcher and in the top left of the knowledge base along with the name.

collaborativeEditing.description: Whether this team has collaborative editing in documents globally enabled.

defaultCollectionId.description: If set then the referenced collection is where users will be redirected to after signing in instead of the Home screen

documentEmbeds.description: Whether this team has embeds in documents globally enabled. It can be disabled to reduce potential data leakage to third parties.

guestSignin.description: Whether this team has guest signin enabled. Guests can signin with an email address and are not required to have a Google Workspace/Slack SSO account once invited.

inviteRequired.description: Whether an invite is required to join this team, if false users may join with a linked SSO provider.

memberCollectionCreate.description: Whether members are allowed to create new collections. If false then only admins can create collections.

name.description: The name of this team, it is usually auto-generated when the first SSO connection is made but can be changed if neccessary.

sharing.description: Whether this team has share links globally enabled. If this value is false then all sharing UI and APIs are disabled.

subdomain.description: Represents the subdomain at which this team's knowledge base can be accessed.

url.description: The fully qualified URL at which this team's knowledge base can be accessed.

avatarUrl.description: The URL for the image associated with this user, it will be displayed in the application UI and email notifications.

createdAt.description: The date and time that this user first signed in or was invited as a guest.

email.description: The email associated with this user, it is migrated from Slack or Google Workspace when the SSO connection is made but can be changed if neccessary.

isSuspended.description: Whether this user has been suspended.

lastActiveAt.description: The last time this user made an API request, this value is updated at most every 5 minutes.

name.description: The name of this user, it is migrated from Slack or Google Workspace when the SSO connection is made but can be changed if neccessary.

count.description: The number of times the user has viewed the document.

firstViewedAt.description: When the document was first viewed by the user

lastViewedAt.description: When the document was last viewed by the user

info.description:
# Introduction

The Outline API is structured in an RPC style. It enables you to
programatically interact with all aspects of Outlineâ€™s data â€“ in fact, the
main application is built on exactly the same API.

The API structure is available as an
[openapi specification](https://github.com/outline/openapi) if thatâ€™s your
jam â€“ it can be used to generate clients for most programming languages.

# Making requests

Outlineâ€™s API follows simple RPC style conventions where each API endpoint is
a `POST` method on `https://app.getoutline.com/api/:method`. Only HTTPS is
supported and all response payloads are JSON.

When making `POST` requests, request parameters are parsed depending on
Content-Type header. To make a call using JSON payload, you must pass
Content-Type: application/json header, hereâ€™s an example using CURL:

```
curl https://app.getoutline.com/api/documents.info \
-X 'POST' \
-H 'authorization: Bearer MY_API_KEY' \
-H 'content-type: application/json' \
-H 'accept: application/json' \
-d '{"id": "outline-api-NTpezNwhUP"}'
```

Or, with JavaScript:

```javascript
const response = await fetch("https://app.getoutline.com/api/documents.info", {
  method: "POST",
  headers: {
    Accept: "application/json",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    Authorization: "Bearer MY_API_KEY"
  }
})

const body = await response.json();
const document = body.data;
```

# Authentication

## API key

You can create new API keys under **Settings => API & Apps**. Be
careful when handling your keys as they give access to all of your documents,
you should treat them like passwords and they should never be committed to
source control.

To authenticate with API, you should supply the API key as the `Authorization` header
(`Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY`).

## OAuth 2.0

OAuth 2.0 is a widely used protocol for authorization and authentication. It allows users
to grant third-party _or_ internal applications access to their resources without sharing
their credentials. To use OAuth 2.0 you need to follow these steps:

1. Register your application under **Settings => Applications**
2. Obtain an access token by exchanging the client credentials for an access token
3. Use the access token to authenticate requests to the API

Some API endpoints allow unauthenticated requests for public resources and
they can be called without authentication

# Scopes

Scopes are used to limit the access of an API key or application to specific resources. For example,
an application may only need access to read documents, but not write them. Scopes can
be global in the case of `read` and `write` scopes, specific to an API endpoint like
`documents.read` and `documents.create`, or use wildcard scopes like `documents.*`.

Some examples of scopes that can be used are:

- `documents.read`: Allows reading documents
- `documents.write`: Allows writing documents
- `documents.*`: Allows all document-related actions
- `users.*`: Allows all user-related actions
- `read`: Allows all read actions
- `write`: Allows all write actions

# Errors

All successful API requests will be returned with a 200 or 201 status code
and `ok: true` in the response payload. If thereâ€™s an error while making the
request, the appropriate status code is returned with the error message:

```
{
  "ok": false,
  "error": "Not Found"
}
```

# Pagination

Most top-level API resources have support for "list" API methods. For instance,
you can list users, documents, and collections. These list methods share
common parameters, taking both `limit` and `offset`.

Responses will echo these parameters in the root `pagination` key, and also
include a `nextPath` key which can be used as a handy shortcut to fetch the
next page of results. For example:

```
{
  ok: true,
  status: 200,
  data: [â€¦],
  pagination: {
    limit: 25,
    offset: 0,
    nextPath: "/api/documents.list?limit=25&offset=25"
  }
}
```

# Rate limits

Like most APIs, Outline has rate limits in place to prevent abuse. Endpoints
that mutate data are more restrictive than read-only endpoints. If you exceed
the rate limit for a given endpoint, you will receive a `429 Too Many Requests`
status code.

The response will include a `Retry-After` header that indicates how many seconds
you should wait before making another request.

# Policies

Most API resources have associated "policies", these objects describe the
current authentications authorized actions related to an individual resource. It
should be noted that the policy "id" is identical to the resource it is
related to, policies themselves do not have unique identifiers.

For most usecases of the API, policies can be safely ignored. Calling
unauthorized methods will result in the appropriate response code â€“ these can
be used in an interface to adjust which elements are visible.
info.title: Outline API

post.description: Creating an attachment object creates a database record and returns the inputs needed to generate a signed url and upload the file from the client to cloud storage.

documentId.description: Identifier for the associated document, if any.

size.description: Size of the file attachment in bytes.

post.description: Deleting an attachment is permanant. It will not delete references or links to the attachment that may exist in your documents.
Load an attachment from where it is stored based on the id. If the attachment is private then a temporary, signed url with embedded credentials is generated on demand.
Retrieve authentication options
Retrieve authentication details for the current API key
This method allows you to give all members in a group access to a collection.
post.summary: Add a group to a collection

post.description: This method allows you to add a user membership to the specified collection.

color.description: A hex color code for the collection icon

description.description: A brief description of the collection, markdown supported.
description.example: HR documentation is confidential and should be handled with care.

icon.description: A string that represents an icon in the outline-icons package or an emoji

sharing.description: Whether public sharing of documents is allowed

post.description: Delete a collection and all of its documents. This action canâ€™t be undone so please be careful.

Triggers a bulk export of the collection in markdown format and their attachments. If documents are nested then they will be nested in folders inside the zip file. The endpoint returns a `FileOperation` that can be queried to track the progress of the export and get the url for the final file.

Triggers a bulk export of all documents in and their attachments. The endpoint returns a `FileOperation` that can be queried through the fileOperations endpoint to track the progress of the export and get the url for the final file.
This method allows you to list a collections group memberships. This is the list of groups that have been given access to the collection.

query.description: If set, will filter the results by collection name.

statusFilter.description: An optional array of statuses to filter by.

post.description: This method allows you to list a collections individual memberships. It's important to note that memberships returned from this endpoint do not include group memberships.
This method allows you to revoke all members in a group access to a collection. Note that members of the group may still retain access through other groups or individual memberships.
This method allows you to remove a user from the specified collection.

color.description: A hex color code for the collection icon

description.description: A brief description of the collection, markdown supported.
description.example: HR documentation is confidential and should be handled with care.

icon.description: A string that represents an icon in the outline-icons package or an emoji

sharing.description: Whether public sharing of documents is allowed

post.description: Add a comment or reply to a document, either `data` or `text` is required.

text.description: The body of the comment in markdown.

post.description: Deletes a comment. If the comment is a top-level comment, all its children will be deleted as well.
Retrieve a comment

includeAnchorText.description: Include the document text that the comment is anchored to, if any, in the response.

post.description: This method will list all comments matching the given properties.

includeAnchorText.description: Include the document text that the comment is anchored to, if any, in the response.

post.description: Update a comment
This method allows you to add a user membership to the specified document.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.description: This method allows asking direct questions of your documents â€“ where possible an answer will be provided. Search results will be restricted to those accessible by the current access token. Note that "AI answers" must be enabled for the workspace.

dateFilter.description: Any documents that have not been updated within the specified period will be filtered out

statusFilter.description: Any documents that are not in the specified status will be filtered out

userId.description: Any documents that have not been edited by the user identifier will be filtered out

post.description: Archiving a document allows outdated information to be moved out of sight whilst retaining the ability to optionally search and restore it later.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.description: This method allows you to create or publish a new document. By default a document is set to the collection root. If you want to create a nested/child document, you should pass parentDocumentId to set the parent document.

publish.description: Whether this document should be immediately published and made visible to other team members.

template.description: Whether this document should be considered to be a template.

text.description: The body of the document in markdown

post.description: Deleting a document moves it to the trash. If not restored within 30 days it is permenantly deleted.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

permanent.description: If set to true the document will be destroyed with no way to recover rather than moved to the trash.

post.description: This method will list all draft documents belonging to the current user.

dateFilter.description: Any documents that have not been updated within the specified period will be filtered out

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

data.description: The document content in Markdown formatting

post.description: This method allows you to create a new document by importing an existing file. By default a document is set to the collection root. If you want to create a nested/child document, you should pass parentDocumentId to set the parent document.

file.description: Plain text, markdown, docx, csv, tsv, and html format are supported.

post.summary: Import a file as a document

post.description: Retrieve a document by its `UUID`, `urlId`, or `shareId`. At least one of these parameters must be provided.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

shareId.description: Unique identifier for a document share, a shareId may be used in place of a document UUID

post.description: This method will list all published documents and draft documents belonging to the current user.

collectionId.description: Optionally filter to a specific collection

post.description: Users with direct membership to a document. To list all users with access to a document use `documents.users`.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

query.description: If set, will filter the results by user name

post.description: Move a document to a new location or collection. If no parent document is provided, the document will be moved to the collection root.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.description: This method allows you to remove a user membership from the specified document.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.description: If a document has been archived or deleted, it can be restored. Optionally a revision can be passed to restore the document to a previous point in time.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

revisionId.description: Identifier for the revision to restore to.

post.description: This methods allows you to search your teams documents with keywords. Note that search results will be restricted to those accessible by the current access token.

dateFilter.description: Any documents that have not been updated within the specified period will be filtered out

statusFilter.description: Any documents that are not in the specified status will be filtered out

userId.description: Any documents that have not been edited by the user identifier will be filtered out

context.description: A short snippet of context from the document that includes the search query.
context.example: At Acme Inc our hiring practices are inclusive

ranking.description: The ranking used to order search results based on relevance.

post.description: This method allows you to createa new template using an existing document as the basis
post.summary: Create a template from a document

post.description: Unpublishing a document moves it back to a draft status and out of the collection.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.description: This method allows you to modify an already created document

append.description: If true the text field will be appended to the end of the existing document, rather than the default behavior of replacing it. This is potentially useful for things like logging into a document.

done.description: Whether the editing session has finished, this will trigger any notifications. This property will soon be deprecated.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

publish.description: Whether this document should be published and made visible to other team members, if a draft

text.description: The body of the document in markdown.

post.description: All users with access to a document. To list only users with direct membership to the document use `documents.memberships`

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

query.description: If set, will filter the results by user name.

post.description: This method will list all documents recently viewed by the current user.
Events are an audit trail of important events that happen in the knowledge base.

actorId.description: Filter to events performed by the selected user

auditLog.description: Whether to return detailed events suitable for an audit log. Without this flag less detailed event types will be returned.

collectionId.description: Filter to events performed in the selected collection

documentId.description: Filter to events performed in the selected document

name.description: Filter to a specific event, e.g. "collections.create". Event names are in the format "objects.verb"

id.description: Unique identifier for the file operation.
Unique identifier for the file operation.

post.description: Load the resulting file from where it is stored based on the id. A temporary, signed url with embedded credentials is generated on demand.

id.description: Unique identifier for the file operation.

post.description: This method allows you to add a user to the specified group.
Deleting a group will cause all of its members to lose access to any collections the group has previously been added to. This action canâ€™t be undone so please be careful.

externalId.description: Filter to groups matching an external ID

query.description: Filter to groups matching a search query

userId.description: Filter to groups including a specific user

groupMemberships.description: A preview of memberships in the group, note that this is not all memberships which can be queried from `groups.memberships`.

post.description: List and filter all the members in a group.
This method allows you to remove a user from the group.

avatarUrl.description: A URL pointing to an image representing the OAuth client.

description.description: A short description of this OAuth client.
description.example: Integrate Acme Inc's services into Outline.

developerName.description: The name of the developer who created this OAuth client.

developerUrl.description: The URL of the developer who created this OAuth client.

published.description: Whether the OAuth client is available to other workspaces.

redirectUris.description: List of redirect URIs for the OAuth client.

id.description: Unique identifier for the OAuth client.

post.description: To retrieve information about an OAuth client you must pass either an `id` or a `clientId`.

clientId.description: Public identifier for the OAuth client.

id.description: Unique identifier for the OAuth client.
Unique identifier for the OAuth client.

post.summary: Rotate the secret for an OAuth client

avatarUrl.description: A URL pointing to an image representing the OAuth client.

description.description: A short description of this OAuth client.
description.example: Integrate Acme Inc's services into Outline.

developerName.description: The name of the developer who created this OAuth client.

developerUrl.description: The URL of the developer who created this OAuth client.

id.description: Unique identifier for the OAuth client.

published.description: Whether the OAuth client is available to other workspaces.

redirectUris.description: List of redirect URIs for the OAuth client.

post.description: A revision is a snapshot of a document at a specific point in time. This endpoint allows you to retrieve a specific version of a document by its unique identifier.

documentId.description: The document ID to retrieve revisions for

post.description: Creates a new share link that can be used by to access a document. If you request multiple shares for the same document with the same API key, the same share object will be returned. By default all shares are unpublished.

documentId.description: Unique identifier for a document. One of id or documentId must be provided.

query.description: Filter to shared documents matching a search query

post.description: Makes the share link inactive so that it can no longer be used to access the document.
Allows changing an existing share's published status, which removes authentication and makes it available to anyone with the link.
Stars a document or collection so it appears in the users sidebar. One of either `documentId` or `collectionId` must be provided.

post.summary: Update a stars order in the sidebar

post.description: Activating a previously suspended user allows them to signin again. Users that are activated will cause billing totals to be re-calculated in the hosted version.
Deleting a user removes the object entirely. In almost every circumstance it is preferable to suspend a user, as a deleted user can be recreated by signing in with SSO again.
List and filter all the users in the team
Suspending a user prevents the user from signing in. Users that are suspended are also not counted against billing totals in the hosted version.
Update a users name or avatar. If no `id` is passed then the user associated with the authentication will be updated by default.
Change the role of a user, only available to admin authorization.
Creates a new view for a document. This is documented in the interests of thoroughness however it is recommended that views are not created from outside of the Outline UI.
List all users that have viewed a document and the overall view count.

documentId.description: The document ID to retrieve views for

tags.description:
`Attachments` represent a file uploaded to cloud storage. They are created
before the upload happens from the client and store all the meta information
such as file type, size, and location.
tags.name: Attachments

tags.description:
`Auth` represents the current API Keys authentication details. It can be
used to check that a token is still valid and load the IDs for the current
user and team.
tags.name: Auth

tags.description:
`Collections` represent grouping of documents in the knowledge base, they
offer a way to structure information in a nested hierarchy and a level
at which read and write permissions can be granted to individual users or
groups of users.
tags.name: Collections

tags.description:
`Comments` represent a comment either on a selection of text in a document
or on the document itself.
tags.name: Comments

tags.description:
`Documents` are what everything else revolves around. A document represents
a single page of information and always returns the latest version of the
content. Documents are stored in [Markdown](https://spec.commonmark.org/)
formatting.
tags.name: Documents

tags.description:
`Events` represent an artifact of an action. Whether it is creating a user,
editing a document, changing permissions, or any other action â€“ an event
is created that can be used as an audit trail or activity stream.
tags.name: Events

tags.description:
`FileOperations` represent background jobs for importing or exporting files.
You can query the file operation to find the state of progress and any
resulting output.
tags.name: FileOperations

tags.description:
`Groups` represent a list of users that logically belong together, for
example there might be groups for each department in your organization.
Groups can be granted access to collections with read or write permissions.
tags.name: Groups

tags.description:
`OAuthClients` represent OAuth clients that can be used to authenticate
users with third-party services.
tags.name: OAuthClients

tags.description:
`OAuthAuthentications` represent individual scoped authentications between
Outline and an `OAuthClient`.
tags.name: OAuthAuthentications

tags.description:
`Revisions` represent a snapshop of a document at a point in time. They
are used to keep tracking of editing and collaboration history â€“ a document
can also be restored to a previous revision if neccessary.
tags.name: Revisions

tags.description:
`Shares` represent authorization to view a document without being a member
of the team. Shares are created in order to give access to documents publicly.
Each user that shares a document will have a unique share object.
tags.name: Shares

tags.description:
`Stars` represent a favorited document or collection in the application sidebar.
Each user has their own collection of starred items.
tags.name: Stars

tags.description:
`Users` represent an individual with access to the knowledge base. Users
can be created automatically when signing in with SSO or when a user is
invited via email.
tags.name: Users

tags.description:
`Views` represent a compressed record of an individual users views of a
document. Individual views are not recorded but a first, last and total
is kept per user.
tags.name: Views
